cyclone.name: CHRIS
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander off the North Carolina coast through Monday, then turn northeast and accelerate away from the U.S. East Coast toward the open Atlantic and Newfoundland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Not expected to make landfall (remains offshore)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells expected along the North Carolina and mid-Atlantic coasts, including Virginia beaches
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor water level fluctuations from persistent onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–2 inches of rain to coastal Virginia early next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents may impact vessel traffic and terminal operations
